Description: Terracotta lamp. Applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with cross above and below filling-hole; ring-and-dot pattern on each side (part of the upper cross is obscured by handle). Shoulder decorated with crosses, leaf, ovule, and group of raised points; below is a row of raised points. Undefined base. Pink clay with mica covered with a red-brown slip. A wick survives inside. Burnt around spout.
Curator's comments: Same Series: Gayet, A.J., 1902. ‘L'art copte : école d'Alexandrie, architecture monastique, sculpture, peinture, art somptuaire’. Paris : E. Leroux, p. 95. Bibl. 'Liverpool AAA' xiv, 1927, p. 73.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2232)
